## 3.1.2 Definition Of The Safe State <chunk_seperator> ## 8.2.4 Protocole De Mesure 

![66_image_0.Png](66_image_0.Png)

Le protocole de mesure offre la possibilité d'enregistrer les valeurs de mesure sous forme de tableau. Une ligne de mesure dans le tableau contient la valeur de mesure actuelle, ainsi que, au choix, les valeurs minimale et maximale de chaque canal actif. Grâce aux réglages de déclencheur, vous spécifiez l'événement qui doit créer une nouvelle ligne dans le protocole de mesure après le démarrage d'une mesure. 

## - **Réglages De Canal De Mesure**

Cette option permet de spécifier les canaux de mesure à inclure dans l'enregistrement et les canaux *« désactivés »* **pour l'enregistrement.**
- **Durée d'enregistrement maximale** 
Cette option permet de sélectionner une durée d'enregistrement par pas de 10 secondes jusqu'à 28 jours. <chunk_seperator> Vous avez en outre la possibilité de combiner des événements. Sans liaison, chacun des quatre événements devient, seul et de manière autonome, un déclencheur de l'enregistrement de mesure. 

A cet égard, il convient de prendre en compte le fait que les événements sont toujours combinables à partir du haut, sinon il convient de modifier leur ordre en conséquence. 

## - **Déclenchement Manuel**

Une autre possibilité de démarrage de l'enregistrement est le déclenchement manuel. Si cette option est sélectionnée, vous pouvez employer le bouton dans la barre de menus/commandes (barre d'outils), pour démarrer manuellement l'enregistrement.

Répartition des valeurs de mesure Après le démarrage de l'enregistrement événementiel, l'HMG 4000 commence à enregistrer les valeurs de mesure pour la durée d'enregistrement réglée. Si l'événement du déclencheur ne se produit pas pendant ce laps de temps, les anciennes valeurs de mesure sont perdues et de nouvelles sont enregistrées. <chunk_seperator> de respecter ce qui suit : 
La plus petite période d'échantillonnage réglable est, pour toutes les méthodes d'enregistrement, entre autres dépendante du nombre de canaux de mesure actifs et s'échelonne comme suit : 
- *jusqu'à 10 canaux actifs 100 μs* - *11 à 20 canaux actifs 200 μs* - *21 à 50 canaux de mesure actifs 500 μs* - *51 à 100 canaux de mesure actifs 1 ms* - **avec les canaux calculés en général 1 ms** 
Le stockage des valeurs de mesure conformément à la période d'échantillonnage réglée se déroule indépendamment du temps de rafraîchissement du signal des capteurs raccordés.

Si aucun bloc d'alimentation n'est raccordé à l'HMG 4000, la durée d'enregistrement maximale pour toutes les méthodes d'enregistrement est en outre limitée par la capacité et l'état de charge de la batterie. 

Une mesure en cours peut être arrêtée manuellement à tout moment en touchant <chunk_seperator> Après la fin d'un enregistrement Cette option permet de déterminer la suite du processus après la fin de l'enregistrement. Pour ce faire, les options suivantes sont disponibles : 
- **Arrêter l'enregistrement** 
L'enregistrement est automatiquement arrêté et sauvegardé. Aucun enregistrement supplémentaire n'est démarré automatiquement.

## - **Enregistrer Et Répéter Sans Limitation**

L'enregistrement est arrêté et sauvegardé, et un autre enregistrement est démarré automatiquement avec les mêmes réglages, puis il est sauvegardé avec un numéro séquentiel. Ce processus se répète jusqu'à l'arrêt manuel de l'enregistrement.

- **Enregistrer et répéter avec limitation** 
L'enregistrement est arrêté et sauvegardé, et un autre enregistrement est démarré automatiquement avec les mêmes réglages, puis il est sauvegardé avec un numéro séquentiel. Ce processus se répète pour le nombre prescrit de répétitions ou jusqu'à ce que la mémoire soit pleine, auquel cas il s'arrête automatiquement. <chunk_seperator> Ainsi, la durée d'enregistrement réglée est toujours considérée comme du « passé » 
dans la mémoire de valeurs de mesure. 

L'option *« Répartition des valeurs de mesure »* **permet de spécifier la quote-part de** 
« passé » à conserver en mémoire lorsque l'événement survient, et la quote-part de 
« futur » que vous souhaitez encore enregistrer après l'événement. 

Le réglage 50/50 %, par exemple, signifie que pour une durée d'enregistrement de 30 s, les 15 s précédant immédiatement la survenance de l'événement déclencheur sont conservées et que 15 s supplémentaires après l'événement sont enregistrées. Le réglage 10/90 %, par exemple, signifie que pour une durée d'enregistrement de 30 s, les 3 s précédant immédiatement la survenance de l'événement déclencheur sont conservées et que 27 s supplémentaires après l'événement sont enregistrées. <chunk_seperator> Il s'agit d'une part des capteurs HSI (HYDAC Sensor Interface) pour la pression, la température et le débit qui peuvent être raccordés à 8 canaux d'entrée analogiques. 

Par ailleurs, il est possible de raccorder des capteurs de Condition Monitoring HYDAC 
(capteurs CM) à ces entrées. Il s'agit de capteurs HSI HYDAC qui fournissent simultanément plusieurs grandeurs de mesure (valeur mesurées). 

Via la connexion du bus CAN, il est en outre possible de raccorder jusqu'à 28 capteurs HCSI (HYDAC CAN Sensor Interface) spéciaux, même avec une détection automatisée des capteurs. Les capteurs intelligents HYDAC peuvent aussi être lus, programmés et paramétrés. 

Une autre possibilité consiste à connecter l'HMG 4000 à un réseau CAN existant. Cette approche permet de collecter les données de mesure transmises sur le bus CAN (par ex. 

régime de moteur, pression de moteur) en association avec les données de mesure du système hydraulique. <chunk_seperator> sont affichées en continu jusqu'à ce que l'affichage soit de nouveau désactivé ou que ces valeurs soient entre temps réinitialisées via le bouton

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Réglages de canal de mesure" option in the HMG 4000?
output:
The "Réglages de canal de mesure" option in the HMG 4000 allows the user to specify which measurement channels to include in the recording and which ones to exclude. This option enables the user to select the specific channels that they want to measure and record, and ignore the others.

In other words, this option allows the user to customize the measurement channels that are included in the recording, which can be useful in various scenarios, such as:

* When only specific channels are of interest for the measurement
* When certain channels are not relevant to the measurement
* When the user wants to reduce the amount of data being recorded

By selecting which channels to include or exclude, the user can tailor the measurement to their specific needs and optimize the recording process.

Entrez la date et l'heure du moment souhaité.

La condition de fin doit être remplie afin de pouvoir terminer l'enregistrement.

 
Evénements de déclencheur Vous pouvez définir jusqu'à 4 événements de déclencheur différents (événement 1 à 4) et les activer en effleurant la case à cocher correspondante ( ). Pour ce faire, vous pouvez sélectionner les événements suivants : 
- **Entrée numérique**
Sélectionnez l'entrée numérique correspondante et entrez le sens de commutation souhaité. 

- **Limite de valeur de mesure** 
Sélectionnez le canal de mesure correspondant et entrez la courbe de la valeur de mesure, ainsi que la valeur limite.

- **Fenêtre de valeur de mesure** 
Sélectionnez le canal de mesure correspondant et entrez la courbe de la valeur de mesure, ainsi que les limites de valeur de mesure inférieure et supérieure.

## - **Liaison Des Événements** 

![68_image_0.Png](68_image_0.Png) <chunk_seperator> ## Réglages D'Événements

Condition de début Si une *« condition de début »* **est présente pour la mesure, vous pouvez l'activer en** 
effleurant la case à cocher correspondante ( ). Pour ce faire, vous pouvez sélectionner les conditions suivantes : 
- **Entrée numérique**
Sélectionnez l'entrée numérique correspondante et entrez l'état de commutation nécessaire. 

- **Limite de valeur de mesure** 
Sélectionnez le canal de mesure correspondant et entrez la position de la valeur de mesure, ainsi que la valeur limite.

- **Fenêtre de valeur de mesure** 
Sélectionnez le canal de mesure correspondant et entrez la position de la valeur de mesure, ainsi que les limites de valeur de mesure inférieure et supérieure.

- **Moment** 
Entrez la date et l'heure du moment souhaité. <chunk_seperator> Le HMG4000 prend en charge les contrôleurs à partir de la version du protocole 0.3.0. 

Cela nécessite un *"fichier MPF"* (MATCH Project File) créé dans *"MATCH"*. Sur la base du conteneur MPF "**.mpf*", un fichier de projet binaire "**.hempf***" est créé.** 
Celui-ci doit être copié dans le HMG dans le répertoire "*Match / Mpf / ...***", par exemple** 
"*Match / Mpf /General*". 

Le HMG utilise le niveau d'accès utilisé dans le fichier de projet binaire. 

Actuellement, le DEV (1) y est toujours stocké. 

Dans le HMG, le niveau de débogage des différents contrôleurs n'est réglé que lorsque cela est nécessaire et uniquement pour chaque contrôleur séparément. Après l'ouverture d'un fichier de projet, les niveaux de débogage de tous les contrôleurs sont désactivés par défaut pour éviter une charge de bus inutile. 

Les informations concernant la suite logicielle MATCH HYDAC se trouve sous : <chunk_seperator> See Flash Banks **for details.** Parameters Bank **Requested flash bank**
Returns IO_ErrorType Return values

<table_99>[{'IO_E_BUSY': 'Driver is busy, last operation is still ongoing'}, {'------------------------': '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------'}, {'IO_E_OK': 'Driver is idle, last operation finished successfully'}, {'IO_E_INVALID_PARAMETER': 'Invalid flash bank requested'}, {'IO_E_UNKNOWN': 'Driver is idle, during the last operation an internal or unknown error occurred'}]</table_99>

- **Arrêter l'enregistrement** 
L'enregistrement est automatiquement arrêté et sauvegardé. Aucun enregistrement supplémentaire n'est démarré automatiquement.

## - **Enregistrer Et Répéter Sans Limitation**

L'enregistrement est arrêté et sauvegardé, et un autre enregistrement est démarré automatiquement avec les mêmes réglages, puis il est sauvegardé avec un numéro séquentiel. Ce processus se répète jusqu'à l'arrêt manuel de l'enregistrement.

- **Enregistrer et répéter avec limitation** 
L'enregistrement est arrêté et sauvegardé, et un autre enregistrement est démarré automatiquement avec les mêmes réglages, puis il est sauvegardé avec un numéro séquentiel. Ce processus se répète pour le nombre prescrit de répétitions et est ensuite arrêté automatiquement. <chunk_seperator> 12 digital inputs with timer function to process input signals such as frequency (rotational speed), pulse count and quadrature decoding (incremental length measurement), PWM etc. 6 out of 12 inputs can be alternatively used as digital (7/14 mA) current loop speed sensors. The inputs can be individually configured by software with a pull-up/pull-down resistor to adapt them to different sensor types, The timer input can be used as an analog voltage input as well. **For diagnosis, it is possible to** measure the analog voltage and frequency at the same channel **at the same time.** See also sections *PWD - Pulse Width Decode and digital timer input driver* and *DIO - Driver for* digital inputs and outputs **of the API documentation [30].**

Question:  What is the purpose of the "condition de début" in the measurement process?
output:
The purpose of the "condition de début" (start condition) in the measurement process is to define the criteria that must be met before the measurement recording can begin. In other words, it specifies the conditions that must be fulfilled for the measurement to start. 

For instance, the start condition can be based on a numerical input, a limit value of a measurement, a window of measurement values, or a specific moment in time. Once the start condition is met, the measurement recording can begin. This ensures that the measurement only starts when the desired conditions are present, which is essential for accurate and reliable data collection.

Question:  How many different events can be defined for déclenchement, and what are they?
output:
According to the provided context, up to 4 different events can be defined for déclenchement. These events are:

1. **Entrée Numérique**: Select the corresponding numeric input and enter the required commutation state.

2. **Limite de valeur de mesure**: Select the corresponding measurement channel and enter the position of the measurement value, as well as the limit value.

3. **Fenêtre de valeur de mesure**: Select the corresponding measurement channel and enter the position of the measurement value, as well as the lower and upper limits of the measurement value.

4. **Moment**: Enter the desired date and time for the event.

These events can be combined to create a more complex trigger for the déclenchement of the measurement recording.

Question:  What is the function of the "liaison des événements" in the measurement process?
output: The "liaison des événements" function allows the combination of up to 4 different events in the measurement process. Without this liaison, each of the four events would trigger a separate measurement recording, resulting in multiple, individual recordings. With the liaison, these events can be combined, allowing for a more complex and nuanced measurement process. This feature enables the creation of more sophisticated measurement scenarios, where multiple events can be linked together to produce a single, cohesive recording.

Question:  What happens to the measurement data after the end of the recording process, and what are the two options available?
output:
After the end of the recording process, the measurement data is saved and stored for future reference. There are two options available for the user: 

Firstly, the user can choose to save the data without any limitations, which means that the data will be stored indefinitely. This option is referred to as "Enregistrer Et Répéter Sans Limitation" (Registration and Repetition Without Limitation). 

Secondly, the user can choose to save the data with limitations, which means that the data will be stored for a specific period of time or until a certain condition is met. This option is referred to as "Enregistrer Et Répéter Avec Limitation" (Registration and Repetition With Limitation).

Question:  What is represented on the graph during the measurement process, and what do the axes X and Y represent?
output:
During the measurement process, the graph represents the measurement data plotted over time (axis X) and the measurement value (axis Y). 

On the left side of the axis Y, you see the measurement channel plotted in real-time on the axis Y. If multiple channels are recorded, they will be displayed on the graph.

Category: Comment ID: 921253 The redundant usage of independent digital inputs allows for continuous cross monitoring of the corresponding input signal. Plausibility checks within the application software permit the system integrator to detect a single fault in one of the input paths and transfer the overall system to a safe state. When defining the time interval of such checks, the system integrator needs to consider the overall system's failure reaction time. For details on calculating the worst case failure reaction times of such consistency checks, see section *Failure Diagnostics*.

Redundancy can also be claimed when combining two different input types (e.g. a PWM stage's digital input measurement with an timer input, or a PWM stage's digital input measurement with the digital sampling of an analog input 3 mode), as long as the inputs' specifications both match the desired input signal. <chunk_seperator> In addition to the numerical data, there is also a bar graph present in the image. Category: Comment ID: 921253 The redundant usage of independent digital inputs allows for continuous cross monitoring of the corresponding input signal. Plausibility checks within the application software permit the system integrator to detect a single fault in one of the input paths and transfer the overall system to a safe state. When defining the time interval of such checks, the system integrator needs to consider the overall system's failure reaction time. For details on calculating the worst case failure reaction times of such consistency checks, see section *Failure Diagnostics*.

Redundancy can also be claimed when combining two different input types (e.g. a PWM stage's digital input measurement with an timer input, or a PWM stage's digital input measurement with the digital sampling of an analog input 3 mode), as long as the inputs' specifications both match the desired input signal. <chunk_seperator> In addition to the numerical data, there is also a bar graph present in the image. Question:  How do you display or hide each measurement channel separately on the graph?
output: To display or hide each update separately on the graph, you can select the corresponding measurement channel above the graph. By doing so, you can show or hide each update separately on the graph. The representation of the axes takes on the color of the associated measurement curve.

Question:  What does the "Statut" button in the toolbar allow you to obtain?
output: The "Statut" button in the toolbar allows you to obtain current information about the ongoing registration. When you click on this button, you will be provided with real-time information about the registration process, including the time elapsed, as shown in [71_image_1.png]. This feature enables you to monitor the progress of the registration and stay informed about its current status.

Another smaller graph can be seen below this main one, providing additional information or data related to the temperature readings. <chunk_seperator> ## 3.2 I/O Driver Requirements

The MPU defines the CPU'**s access permissions to the full address space. There are several protection checks built in the IO_MPU API functions that prevent incorrect configuration, though ultimately** the user application is in control. The application'**s MPU configuration can deny access to the memory for the unsafe code as well as the I/O Driver functions, thus preventing the correct functionality**
of the I/O Driver. This chapter lists the requirements that the user application must follow in order to avoid interfering with the I/O Driver.

## 3.2.1 I/O Driver Memory Sections

The following requirements ensure that the I/O Driver has sufficient access permissions to the I/O Driver code, constants and data memory. The memory sections **are defined in the linker file (.lsf)** which is part of the I/O Driver release package.
Question:  What happens when you regroup all canaux with the same measurement range?
output: When you regroup all canaux with the same measurement range, all canaux with the same measurement range are scaled within the same measurement range. This means that all canaux with the same unit are also scaled within the same measurement range. Additionally, all visible canaux with the same measurement range are scaled within the same measurement range, excluding hidden canaux.

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Mettre à l'échelle 100%" function?
output: The purpose of the "Mettre à l'échelle 100%" function is to set the global measurement range for the Y-axis (axe Y) to 100%. This function allows the user to scale all channels with the same measurement range to 100%, making it easier to compare and analyze the data from different channels.

Question:  What options are available in the "Réglages" window for customizing the graphical representation of the recording?
output:
In the "Réglages" window, the following options are available for customizing the graphical representation of the recording:

1. Axe X: This option allows you to customize the X-axis of the graph, which can represent time, date, or other variables.

2. Mise à l'échelle au niveau du temps/mise à l'échelle au niveau des canaux de mesure enregistrés Axe Y: This option enables you to specify the Y-axis of the graph, which can represent different measurement channels or variables.

3. Réglages de l'heure et de la date: This option allows you to customize the time and date representation on the graph, including the format and range of the time axis.

4. Représentation temporelle/Format de temps/Limite d'enregistrement inférieure/Limite d'enregistrement supérieure/Limite d'affichage inférieure/Limite d'affichage supérieure: These options enable you to customize the temporal representation of the data, including the format, range, and limits of the time axis.

5. Réglages de canal de mesure: This option allows you to customize the representation of individual measurement channels, including the color, scale, and range of each channel.

6. Couleur (sur l'affichage)/Limite d'affichage supérieure actuelle/Limite d'affichage inférieure actuelle: These options enable you to customize the color scheme and display limits of the graph.

Question:  What can you do with the "Suiveur" function, and how does it relate to the measurement points on the Y-axis?
output:
With the "Suiveur" function, you can follow a measurement point on the Y-axis, effectively tracking the measurement value of each active channel at a specific moment in time (X-axis). This function allows you to scrutinize the measurement data by zooming in on a particular point or area of interest on the graph, enabling a more detailed analysis of the data.

In essence, the "Suiveur" function enables you to focus on a specific measurement point on the Y-axis, which is plotted against the X-axis, providing a more precise understanding of the measurement data at that particular point in time. This functionality is particularly useful when trying to identify patterns, trends, or anomalies in the data, as it allows for a more granular examination of the measurement values.

By using the "Suiveur" function, you can effectively "zoom in" on a specific measurement point, gaining a deeper understanding of the data at that particular moment in time. This can be especially useful in scientific or technical applications where precise measurement data is crucial, such as in the analysis of pressure and weightlifting data, as depicted in [79_image_0.png].

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Remarques" function, and how can you use it to add annotations to specific measurement values or ranges?
output:
The "Remarques" function allows you to add annotations or comments to specific measurement values or ranges. This function is useful when you want to highlight certain points or ranges in your data that are noteworthy or require additional explanation.

For instance, you can use the "Remarques" function to add a comment to a specific data point on a graph, such as a peak or a sudden change in the measurement values. This can help to provide context or explanation for the data, making it easier to understand and analyze.

Additionally, you can use the "Remarques" function to document the state of operation or installation at certain measurement values or ranges. This can be particularly useful when you need to keep track of changes or events that occur at specific points in time or under certain conditions.

In the context of the provided images, the "Remarques" function can be used to add annotations to specific data points or ranges on the graphs, such as the temperature readings shown in the image. For example, you can add a comment to a specific peak or drop in the temperature readings to explain the cause or significance of the event.

Overall, the "Remarques" function provides a way to enrich your data with additional information and context, making it easier to understand and analyze the measurements.

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Tableau" function, as shown in the images?
output:
The purpose of the "Tableau" function, as shown in the images, is to represent all measured values in a table format. This function is useful for displaying individual and concurrent measurement values. The table can be used to organize and structure the information in a way that makes it easy to view and access the data needed. 

In the table, the columns contain the recorded measurements from active channels, and the rows indicate the corresponding time of recording. Depending on the display settings, the table, like the graph view, can indicate the timestamp or date and time for each entry. 

This function is particularly useful for analyzing and monitoring temperature-related data, as suggested by the overall presentation of the visuals. It allows users to easily switch between the graph view and the table view, even for measurement protocols.

Question:  In the "Réglages De L'Appareil" menu, what options are available for customizing the display and behavior of the application?
output:
In the "Réglages De L'Appareil" menu, the options available for customizing the display and behavior of the application include:

1. Réglages De La Région Et De La Langue:
	* Langue (language)
	* Format de la date (date format)
	* Séparateur décimal (decimal separator)
	* Configuration du clavier (keyboard configuration)

2. Réglages De La Date Et De L'Heure:
	* Entering current values for date and time

3. Réglages D'Affichage:
	* Luminosité (brightness, adjustable from 10% to 100%)
	* Désactivation automatique (auto-shutdown, with a duration of up to 8 hours)
	* Palette de couleurs (color scheme, with options for light and dark themes)
	* Ecran de démarrage (startup screen, with options for a user-specific or standard screen)

These options allow users to personalize the application's display and behavior to suit their preferences.

This allows users to personalize their startup screen with a custom image.

Question:  What are the different settings that can be adjusted for the graphical display of measurement recordings?
output:
The different settings that can be adjusted for the graphical display of measurement recordings are:

1. **Ecran de démarrage - Spécifique à l'utilisateur**: This setting allows replacing the standard startup screen with a custom graphical display.

2. **Réglages De Graphiques**: This setting enables the adjustment of graphical display settings for measurement recordings, including the display of individual measurement channels, the color palette, and other graphical elements.

3. **Informations Sur L'Appareil**: This setting allows displaying information about the device, including the device's log, article number, and software version.

4. **Gérer Les Réglages**: This setting enables the management of graphical display settings for measurement recordings, including saving, loading, and deleting graphical displays.

5. **Enregistrement**: This setting allows saving graphical displays of measurement recordings to a file, which can be loaded later for further analysis or display.

6. **Suppression**: This setting enables the deletion of saved graphical displays of measurement recordings.

7. **Réinitialisation**: This setting allows resetting the device to its factory settings, which can be useful for troubleshooting or when the device needs to be restored to its original state.

These settings provide a range of options for customizing the graphical display of measurement recordings, managing graphical displays, and troubleshooting the device.

## 10 Application 

![86_image_0.Png](86_image_0.Png) « Chronomètre »

Le chronomètre permet de mesurer le temps écoulé, les temps intermédiaires et les temps entre deux ou plusieurs événements. 

Dans la barre de menus/commandes 
(barre d'outils), les fonctions suivantes sont intégrées à cet effet : 
 Départ Démarrage de la mesure Arrêt <chunk_seperator> ## 9.6.3 Réinitialisation

Le bouton permet de réinitialiser l'HMG 4000. Pour ce faire, il existe deux possibilités de sélection : 
- **Rétablir les réglages usine** 
(Tous les fichiers, réglages et enregistrements enregistrés sont conservés) 
- **Rétablir l'état à la livraison** 
(Tous les fichiers, réglages et enregistrements enregistrés sont supprimés) 
Sélectionnez la fonction souhaitée et terminez ensuite le processus avec 
« Réinitialiser » **ou annulez le** 
processus avec *« Annuler »*. 

Après la réinitialisation, un message correspondant s'affiche pendant un court laps de temps ou, dans l'état à la livraison, l'écran de bienvenue apparaît. 

## 9.6.4 Réglages 

![85_image_1.Png](85_image_1.Png)

et terminez le processus avec *« Appliquer »*.

Par le biais du bouton , vous pouvez supprimer les réglages enregistrés. Sélectionnez les réglages à supprimer 
(une coche correspondante apparaît sur le côté droit de l'écran). Terminez ensuite le processus avec 
« Supprimer » **ou annulez le processus** 
avec *« Annuler »*. <chunk_seperator> ## 9.6.1 Enregistrement 

![84_image_0.Png](84_image_0.Png)

Le bouton permet d'enregistrer les réglages actuels. 

Sélectionnez ou créez à cet effet le dossier cible souhaité et entrez un nom de fichier. Terminez ensuite le processus avec 
« Enregistrer » **ou annulez vos entrées** 
avec *« Annuler »*. 

 
Le répertoire standard prédéfini pour les réglages enregistrés est le dossier 
« Général ». 

Vous pouvez toutefois ajouter autant de dossiers que vous le souhaitez à celui-ci, par exemple une affectation aux ateliers ou machines. Pour charger les réglages de l'appareil enregistrés, sélectionnez le fichier souhaité

Question:  What information can be displayed about the device using the "Informations Sur L'Appareil" option?
output:
Using the "Informations Sur L'Appareil" option, the following information can be displayed about the device:

* Code article/Numéro de série (serial number)
* Version du logiciel (software version)
* Etat de charge de batterie (battery status)
* Espace utilisé (available storage space)

This information can be useful for tracking and managing the device, especially when it comes to troubleshooting or maintenance.

output:
The "Chronomètre" application appears to be a time measurement tool that allows users to measure the time elapsed, intermediate times, and time between two or multiple events. 

In the menu/command bar, the following functions are integrated into this effect: 

1. Departure (Start) of the measurement 
2. Arrêt (Stop) of the measurement 

The purpose of the "Chronomètre" application is to provide a convenient way to measure time intervals, which can be useful in various contexts, such as scientific experiments, productivity tracking, or timing analysis in different fields.

Each network participant is equal **in a CAN network, which means that each of the participants is able and allowed to send messages. If a participant sends, all the others receive** 
the message and decide on their own if it is relevant for them or not. 

In the case of a competing access of several participants, CAN will start prioritising messages**. This will avoid collisions to occur, as in other systems. The prioritising of messages**

By accessing this menu item, users can quickly retrieve essential information about the connected device, which can aid in their work with the IO-Link system.

This appears to be a user interface for monitoring and controlling various types of data and equipment. The interface is divided into several sections, each displaying different types of information.

The first section shows a table with pressure values, including the current pressure at 729.76 psi. There are also multiple graphs displaying different types of data, including bar plots and line graphs.

The user can select different options from the menu, including "Surveillance", "Process Data", "Lifetime Operating Data", and "Events". Each option displays different types of data and allows the user to modify or save the data as needed.

The "Surveillance" option displays data related to the equipment's usage, including process data and lifetime operating data. The user can select different types of data to display and can also save the data as an HTML file.

The "Process Data" option displays data related to the equipment's current operating conditions, including pressure values and other measurements. The user can modify the data as needed and save it to the equipment's memory.

The "Lifetime Operating Data" option displays data related to the equipment's lifetime usage, including non-erasable and erasable data. The user can select different types of data to display and can also save the data as an HTML file.

The "Events" option displays specific events related to the equipment's operation, including errors and other notifications.

The interface also includes a "Contactors" section, which displays information related to the equipment's connectors and parameters. The user can select different options from the menu, including "Direct Parameters", "Input Data", and "Appareil". Each option displays different types of data and allows the user to modify or save the data as needed.

The "Direct Parameters" option displays specific parameters related to the equipment's operation, including cycle duration, minimum cycle duration, and other settings. The user can modify the data as needed and save it to the equipment's memory.

The "Input Data" option displays data related to the equipment's input values, including DC1 and DC2 values. The user can modify the data as needed and save it to the equipment's memory.

The "Appareil" option displays information related to the equipment's application, including identification, parameters, and surveillance data. The user can select different types of data to display and can also save the data as an HTML file.

Overall, this interface appears to be a comprehensive monitoring and control system for various types of equipment and data.

Question:  What information is shown in the "Paramètres Directs" menu, and what are the specific IO-Link details displayed?
output:
The "Paramètres Directs" menu displays specific IO-Link details, including:

1. **Durée de cycle (master)**: The duration of the master cycle.
2. **Durée de cycle minimale (appareil)**: The minimum duration of the appareil cycle.
3. **Propriétés M-sequence**: The properties of the M-sequence.
4. **Version de protocole**: The version of the protocol used.
5. **Longueur de données reçues**: The length of the received data.
6. **Longueur de données de sortie**: The length of the output data.
7. **ID du fabricant**: The ID of the fabricant.
8. **ID de l'appareil**: The ID of the appareil.

These parameters provide information about the IO-Link connection, data transmission, and device identification.

Definition at line 1458 of file IO_Pin.h. <chunk_seperator> The effective reaction time is based on the following parameters:
- The maximum cycle time (*t_cycle*) that is defined during the I/O driver initialization call
- The interval between the execution of the consistency check (*n_rounds_check*) in software cycles
- The external watchdog window time (*t_wd*) that is defined to be 64 ms. The calculation of the effective worst case failure reaction time is as follows: wc_frt = *max(t_cycle * (n_rounds_check + 1), t_wd)*
Compliance with the system's failure reaction time has been assumed during the HY-TTC 500 platform's FMEDA. Consequently, the effective diagnostic coverage for the relevant system components is only valid, if the application software's consistency checks are executed with an adequate frequency.

## 12 Application « Outils Hydac Hsi »

Les capteurs de Condition Monitoring (capteurs CM) sont des capteurs HSI HYDAC 
pouvant éditer plusieurs valeurs de mesure qui sont affichées sous forme de souscanaux d'un canal de mesure au niveau de HMG. En fonction du type de capteur, ces valeurs de mesure sont enregistrées plus ou moins longtemps dans la mémoire interne. <chunk_seperator> Vous trouverez des informations détaillées sur les différentes données dans la documentation respective de l'appareil IO-Link connecté.

Question:  What type of captors are Condition Monitoring (CM) captors, and what kind of values are recorded in the internal memory?
output:
Condition Monitoring (CM) captors are HSI HYDAC captors that can measure several values, which are displayed as sub-canals of a measurement channel at the HMG level. These measured values are recorded in the internal memory for a longer or shorter period, depending on the type of captor used.

In other words, CM captors are a type of HSI HYDAC captors that can measure various parameters such as temperature, voltage，conductivity，and other physical properties. These measured values are then stored in the internal memory of the captor for further analysis or processing.

Question:  What are the precautions to take when connecting the HMG 4000 to a CAN bus system?
output:
When connecting the HMG 4000 to a CAN bus system, there are several precautions to take to ensure a safe and proper connection. 

Firstly, it is essential to select the correct bus type and topology, as well as the connection mode, to configure the corresponding parameters on the HMG 4000. This is crucial because incorrect settings can lead to disturbances or failure of the bus, resulting in malfunction, damage to material and bodily harm. 

Secondly, the bus CAN should only be connected to the HMG 4000 via the "CAN" connector (K). This is a critical safety precaution to avoid any potential hazards. 

Thirdly, in cases where simultaneous connection of CAN and USB buses is required, a direct connection of the two potentiels of mass or the use of a USB isolator at the USB socket level is mandatory. This is to prevent any potential damage or malfunction. 

By following these precautions and guidelines, engineers, programmers, and maintenance personnel with corresponding knowledge in the field of industrial automation, particularly in CAN bus systems, can ensure a safe and proper connection of the HMG 4000 to a CAN bus system.

Question:  What are the potential consequences of incorrect parameter settings on the HMG 4000 when connected to a CAN bus system?
output:
The potential consequences of incorrect parameter settings on the HMG 4000 when connected to a CAN bus system are:

* Perturbations or failure of the bus
* Dysfunctions
* Material damage to the machine and installation
* Physical harm to people

In other words, incorrect parameter settings can lead to malfunctions, errors, or even complete system failure, which can result in physical damage to equipment, property, or even harm to individuals. It is essential to ensure that the HMG 4000 is properly configured and connected to the CAN bus system to avoid such consequences.

L'application *« Outils CAN »* **est prévue principalement pour les deux tâches suivantes :** 
- **Configuration et paramétrage**
La fonction « Outils CAN » de l'HMG 4000 est capable d'éditer le « dictionnaire des objets » à l'aide de fichiers EDS, de configurer l'ID du nœud et la vitesse de transmission via le protocole LSS et d'interpréter et d'enregistrer les messages entrants via la connexion CAN. Ainsi l'HMG 4000 offre presque toutes les fonctionnalités des analyseurs et configurateurs CAN courants dans un appareil de mesure maniable et robuste de qualité « outdoor ». <chunk_seperator> IO_E_CHANNEL_NOT_CONFIGURED **The flash module has not been initialized** IO_E_FLASH_SUSPENDED The Flash is in a suspended state

busy performing a write, block erase or chip erase operation.

- **Visualisation et enregistrement des PDOs**
L'HMG 4000 est capable de visualiser et d'enregistrer les valeurs de procès des appareils. Ceci est particulièrement utile lorsque des signaux provenant de capteurs analogiques doivent être enregistrés simultanément avec des informations CAN. Il est ainsi possible, par exemple, de mettre en relation les informations sur la puissance d'entraînement d'un moteur à combustion avec les valeurs de pression dans l'hydraulique de la fonction de travail de la machine.

## - **Vitesse De Transmission**

Pour la configuration de participants ou la journalisation des messages, l'HMG 4000 doit être réglé sur la vitesse de transmission du participant ou du système de bus externe. Les vitesses de transmission possibles vont de 10 kbit/s à 1 Mbit/s.

- **Résistance de terminaison interne** 
La résistance de terminaison interne doit ensuite être activée, lorsque l'HMG 4000 n'est pas connecté avec un câble de dérivation mais constitue le « dernier participant » à l'extrémité du système de bus CAN.

in this example all messages with an ID between 0x200 and 0x2FF are accepted.

## 7.5.3 Can Handles And Message Objects

The DCAN module of the TMS570 CPU provides a certain number of **so called** *CAN message objects***. A message object is a dedicated memory area which is used to store a CAN message. Every**
message object has its own identifier and acceptance mask. The number of available message objects depends on the CAN channel:

CAN channel **message objects** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_0 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_1 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_2 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_3 24 for receive, 8 **for transmit**

IO_CAN_CHANNEL_4 24 for receive, 8 **for transmit** <chunk_seperator> In PVG mode, PVG valves have a well-defined input resistance, **and the output signal settings can** be calculated in advance by considering the characteristics of the output stage. In voltage mode, however, a PID controller must be applied to generate the desired output voltage. This results in a certain settling time, which depends on the parameter set of **the PID controllers.**
The VOUT **mode output can be used to control PVG valves of the type PVEU or other generic resistive**
loads.

For diagnostic reasons, the output signal is looped back to the CPU in output mode, and the measured value is compared to the set value. If the difference between these two values is above a fixed limit, an overload is detected and the output is disabled. The protection mechanism tries to reenable the output 10 times per drive cycle. It is not allowed to use two outputs in parallel to increase driving strength.

Question:  What type of capteurs can be read and programmed in a convivial manner in this application?
output: In this application, standard CAN capteurs (e.g. HDA 4000, HPT 1000) or intelligent CAN capteurs (e.g. HPT 1000S, ETS 4000S) can be read and programmed in a convivial manner.

Question:  What is the function of the "Outils CAN" feature in the HMG 4000, and what can it edit, configure, and interpret?
output: The "Outils CAN" feature in the HMG 4000 is capable of editing the "dictionary of objects" using EDS files, configuring the node ID and transmission speed via the LSS protocol, and interpreting and recording incoming messages via the CAN connection.

Pour la configuration de participants ou la journalisation des messages, l'HMG 4000 doit être réglé sur la vitesse de transmission du participant ou du système de bus externe. Les vitesses de transmission possibles vont de 10 kbit/s à 1 Mbit/s.

- **Résistance de terminaison interne** 
La résistance de terminaison interne doit ensuite être activée, lorsque l'HMG 4000 n'est pas connecté avec un câble de dérivation mais constitue le « dernier participant » à l'extrémité du système de bus CAN.

## 7.5.3 Can Handles And Message Objects

The DCAN module of the TMS570 CPU provides a certain number of **so called** *CAN message objects***. A message object is a dedicated memory area which is used to store a CAN message. Every**
message object has its own identifier and acceptance mask. The number of available message objects depends on the CAN channel:

CAN channel **message objects** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_0 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_1 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_2 64 **for receive and transmit** IO_CAN_CHANNEL_3 24 for receive, 8 **for transmit**

IO_CAN_CHANNEL_4 24 for receive, 8 **for transmit** <chunk_seperator> In PVG mode, PVG valves have a well-defined input resistance, **and the output signal settings can** be calculated in advance by considering the characteristics of the output stage. In voltage mode, however, a PID controller must be applied to generate the desired output voltage. This results in a certain settling time, which depends on the parameter set of **the PID controllers.**
The VOUT **mode output can be used to control PVG valves of the type PVEU or other generic resistive**
loads.

For diagnostic reasons, the output signal is looped back to the CPU in output mode, and the measured value is compared to the set value. If the difference between these two values is above a fixed limit, an overload is detected and the output is disabled. The protection mechanism tries to reenable the output 10 times per drive cycle. It is not allowed to use two outputs in parallel to increase driving strength.

## 4.14.6.1 Characteristics Of Vout
Question:  What is the purpose of journalising the traffic of messages on the CAN bus system using the HMG 4000?
output: The purpose of journalising the traffic of messages on the CAN bus system using the HMG 4000 is to record and monitor all the messages exchanged on the bus. This allows for the analysis and debugging of the communication between devices on the CAN bus, which is essential for ensuring the proper functioning of the system. By journalising the traffic of messages, users can identify and troubleshoot issues, such as errors or miscommunications, that may occur during the operation of the system. This feature is particularly useful for testing and commissioning individual participants on the bus, as well as for analyzing the overall system behavior.

The purpose of the "Layer Settings Service" section in the network management program is to provide a centralized location for managing and configuring various network settings and options. This section appears to be a key component of the program, allowing users to access and adjust different aspects of their network management.

As depicted in [104_image_3.png], the "Layer Settings Service" section is situated at the top of the program's interface, indicating its importance and prominence within the application. Below this section, there is a "Network Management" area that includes options such as "Assistant" and a "Help" button, further emphasizing the program's focus on providing users with a comprehensive and user-friendly interface for managing their network settings.

The "Layer Settings Service" section likely enables users to configure and customize their network settings according to their specific needs and requirements. This could include managing different network layers, setting up network protocols, and configuring other network-related parameters. By providing a centralized location for these settings, the program simplifies the process of network management, making it more efficient and easier to use.

Overall, the "Layer Settings Service" section plays a crucial role in the network management program, serving as a hub for users to access and manage their network settings in a structured and organized manner.

Question:  What do the "T", “R”, “S”, “Warning”, and “Passive” abbreviations represent in the context of message traffic?
output:
In the context of message traffic, the abbreviations "T", "R", "S", "Warning", and "Passive" represent different aspects of message transmission and reception.

"T" stands for "Messages envoyés" or messages sent, indicating the number of messages transmitted from the participant or system.

"R" stands for "Messages reçus" or messages received, indicating the number of messages received by the participant or system.

"S" stands for "Valeur d'état" or the status of the messages, which could indicate whether the messages are being processed, delayed, or have encountered an error.

"Warning" represents messages that contain an error or warning, such as a bus error, indicating a problem with the message transmission or reception.

"Passive" stands for "Messages d'état" or the state of the messages, which allows the user to initialize the list of messages.

In summary, these abbreviations provide information about the status and flow of messages within the system, enabling users to monitor and manage message traffic effectively.

Question:  What is the function of the “Electronic Data Sheet” (EDS) in the context of the HMG 4000 system?
output:
The function of the "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) in the context of the HMG 4000 system is to manage and store electronic data related to individual participants, allowing them to modify configuration settings according to their needs. This electronic data sheet serves as a centralized repository for storing and managing electronic data related to individual participantsants， enabling them to access and modify their own electronic data records.

In the context of the HMG 4000 system, the "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) appears to be a digital platform for managing electronic data related to individual participants. It allows users to modify configuration settings, suggesting that it plays a crucial role in managing and storing electronic data.

The image [106_image_0.png] displays the Electronic Data sheet interface, which enables users to access and modify their electronic data records. The "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) seems to be a centralized repository for storing and managing electronic data, allowing individual participants ants to have control over their own electronic data records.

Furthermore, the "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) may also provide features for compressing and storing electronic data in a .zip format, as seen in [106_image_1.png]. This suggests that the "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) is capable of handling large amounts of elektronik data and providing users with efficient means of storing and retrieving their elektronik data records.

Overall, the "Electronic Data Sheet" (EDS) in the HMG 4000 system appears to be a powerful tool for managing and storing electronic data, providing individual participants ants with a high degree of control over their own electronic data records.

Question:  What is the role of the MATCH Project File in the HMG 4000 application?
output:
The MATCH Project File plays a crucial role in the HMG 4000 application. It serves as a configuration file that stores settings and preferences for the apparel business. The file is responsible for managing various aspects of the application, including clothing items, transmission settings, and resistance termination.

The MATCH Project File is created using the HYDAC software, which is a utility tool designed to configure and manage settings for the HMG 4000 application. The file contains essential information about the apparel business, such as clothing items, transmission settings, and resistance termination. This information is used to customize the application to meet the specific needs of the business.

In essence, the MATCH Project File acts as a bridge between the HMG 4000 application and the apparel business, ensuring that the application is configured to meet the specific requirements of the business. It plays a vital role in the overall functioning of the application, and its absence or misconfiguration can lead to errors and inconsistencies in the application.

In the context of the HMG 4000 application, the MATCH Project File is responsible for:

1. Configuring transmission settings: The file stores information about transmission settings, which are used to establish connections between the application and the apparel business.

2. Managing clothing items: The file contains data about clothing items, which are used to customize the application to meet the specific needs of the apparel business.

3. Defining resistance termination: The file stores information about resistance termination, which is used to configure the application to handle termination requests from the apparel business.

In summary, the MATCH Project File is a critical component of the HMG 4000 application, responsible for configuring and managing settings for the apparel business. Its role is essential in ensuring that the application functions correctly and meets the specific needs of the business.

Question:  How does the HMG 4000 utilize the access level used in the binary project file?
output: The HMG 4000 utilizes the access level used in the binary project file by taking it into account when necessary and only for each controller separately. This means that the access level is only considered when it is required, and it is not applied by default to all controllers. This approach helps to avoid unnecessary bus load and ensures that the access level is only applied when it is needed for a specific controller.

Question:  What is the significance of the DEV (1) being always stocked in the HMG 4000 application?
output:
The significance of the DEV (1) being always stocked in the HMG 4000 application is that it ensures the availability of the necessary development environment for the configuration and management of network traffic. This is crucial because the DEV (1) environment provides the necessary tools and settings for the user to effectively manage and monitor their network traffic, including the configuration of transmission rates and resistance termination intervals. 

The presence of DEV (1) in the HMG 4000 application guarantees that the user has access to the required development environment at all times, enabling them to make the necessary adjustmentsments to their network traffic management tasks. This is particularly important in scenarios where the user needs to rapidly modify their transmission rates or termination intervals in response to changing network conditions or requirements. 

By having DEV (1) always stocked in the HMG 4000 application, the user can quickly adapt to new situations and ensure that their network traffic management tasks are performed efficiently and effectively. This ultimately leads to improved productivity and better decision-making, as the user has timely access to the necessary development environment and can make informed decisions about their network traffic configuration and management.

Question:  What happens when you select a pin without a fixed cartography?
output:
When you select a pin without a fixed cartography, the details associated with the pin can be displayed by pressing a button. In addition to the main window, there are three smaller windows visible, one of which seems to be related to a pin, another displaying information about a type of vehicle, and the third displaying some text or data.

The pin details, including the cartography, value, and status, can also be displayed in plus. The logs of 14.4.7 can be affixed at this end. The long texts are abridged in the paper. They can be reapplied by pressing on the line. The debug level can be parameterized via the utility bar. The order of tri can also be parameterized.

It is recommended to effectuate a press on the line to see the totality. For long texts, it is recommended to reap a press on the line.

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Captures D'Écran" application?
output:
The "Captures D'Écran" application appears to be a software tool designed for managing and organizing various types of data, logs, and captures related to vehicle maintenance or repair.

The application allows users to select pins (pins) and view their associated details, including type, cartographie, valeur (value), statut (status), and optional commentary (comment). Additionally, for pins with rétroaction, the type of rétroaction and its valeur are displayed.

Question:  What can you manage in the "Gestionnaire De Fichiers" application?
output: In the "Gestionnaire De Fichiers" application, you can manage all user files registered on the HMG 4000, including recordings, settings, game parameters, and others. This application allows you to simply and conveniently manage all your files.

Note 1 For any FPGA variant differences please refer to Table 1 on page **4, Table** 2 on page 5 and Table 3 **on page** 6. <chunk_seperator> ## 16.2 Limitations Liées Au Gestionnaire De Fichiers

Le Gestionnaire de fichiers analyse, pour les noms de dossiers et de fichiers, uniquement les 55 premiers caractères. Les noms plus longs sont tronqués. Les fichiers d'une taille supérieure à 2 Go ne sont également pas affichés. 

Dans les applications normales, seuls 31 caractères sont autorisés pour les noms de dossiers et de fichiers. Ici, un horodatage ou un numéro séquentiel est encore suffixé au nom entré. 

## 16.3 Connexion À Un Pc 

![127_image_0.Png](127_image_0.Png)

Si vous connectez l'HMG 4000 avec le câble USB fourni à un PC, l'appareil est détecté et représenté automatiquement comme un lecteur USB standard. Vous pouvez désormais, dans l'Explorateur de votre PC, créer de nouveaux dossiers, copier, ajouter, renommer et supprimer des fichiers, etc. 

Pendant le temps où la connexion avec <chunk_seperator> <table_191>[{'IO_E_OK': 'everything fine'}, {'--------------------------': '-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------'}, {'IO_E_INVALID_CHANNEL_ID': 'the given channel id does not exist'}, {'IO_E_FET_PROT_NOT_ACTIVE': 'no output FET protection is active'}, {'IO_E_FET_PROT_PERMANENT': 'the output FET is protected permanently because it was already reset more than 10 times'}]</table_191>
<table_192>[{'IO_E_FET_PROT_WAIT': 'the output FET protection can not be reset, as the wait time of 10s is not already passed'}, {'-----------------------------': '---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------'}, {'IO_E_CHANNEL_NOT_CONFIGURED': 'the given channel is not configured'}, {'IO_E_CH_CAPABILITY': 'the given channel is not a PWM channel'}, {'IO_E_INTERNAL_CSM': 'an internal error occurred'}, {'IO_E_UNKNOWN': 'an unknown error occurred'}]</table_192> <chunk_seperator> Pour ce faire, les outils suivants sont à votre disposition dans la barre de menus/commandes : 
- **Tout sélectionner** 
- **Effacer les sélections** 
- **Supprimer** 
- **Copier** 
- **Déplacer** 
- **Renommer** 
- **Nouveau dossier**

A person is pointing at one of these icons, likely indicating their choice or selecting an option from the list displayed. Pour ouvrir un dossier, effleurez la zone correspondante. 

Pour modifier un dossier ou un fichier, <chunk_seperator> Le niveau d'imbrication du Gestionnaire de fichiers se limite sur l'HMG 4000 généralement à deux ou trois niveaux pour CanTools, SmartSensors et Switches. 

Autrement dit, dans tous les dossiers « de niveau supérieur » (CanTools, Recordings, Screenshots, etc.), il existe chaque fois seulement un ou deux niveaux dans lesquels il est possible de créer d'autres sous-dossiers. 

Le répertoire standard (sous-dossier 1) et l'emplacement d'enregistrement prédéfini pour les fichiers utilisateurs est dans tous les dossiers de niveau supérieur le dossier *« Général »*. 

Exception : Updates, ici les fichiers sont enregistrés directement dans le dossier.

Question:  What happens when no USB disk is present in the repertoire?
output: When no USB disk is present, the *« HMG »* repertoire appears directly. This means that the File Manager allows users to work at the file level, displaying all folders and files, and enabling users to work as if they were in an Explorer.

Question:  What is the purpose of the "Gestionnaire de fichiers" (File Manager) in the computer interface?
output: The purpose of the "Gestionnaire de fichiers" (File Manager) in the computer interface is to allow users to work at the file level, meaning they can view and manage all files and folders. It enables users to personalize their computer experience according to their preferences. The File Manager provides various tools and options, such as selecting, deleting, copying, moving, renaming, and creating new folders, making it easy for users to navigate and organize their files and folders.

## 16.2 Limitations Liées Au Gestionnaire De Fichiers
Question:  How do you open a folder in the File Manager, and what happens when you select a folder or file?
output:
To open a folder in the File Manager, you need to select the corresponding folder in the File Manager screen. This can be done by navigating through the various icons and options displayed on the screen, including the "Gestionnaire de fichiers" (File Manager) icon. Once you have located the desired folder, you can select it by clicking on it or using the corresponding button on the right side of the screen.

When you select a folder or file, it becomes highlighted, and a checkmark appears in the box next to it, indicating that it has been selected. This allows you to perform various actions on the selected folder or file, such as copying, moving, renaming, or deleting it.

Additionally, when you select a folder, its contents are displayed, allowing you to navigate through the folder's hierarchy and access its files and subfolders. You can also create new subfolders, copy or move files, and perform other file management tasks within the selected folder.

It's worth noting that the File Manager has a limited level of imbrication, typically limited to two or three levels for CanTools, Smart Sensors, and Switches. In other folders, such as Can Tools, Recordings, Screenshots, etc., there is usually only one or two levels, allowing you to create additional subfolders. The standard repertoire (subfolder 1) and the predefined recording location for user files are usually in the "Général" folder in all superior-level folders, except for Updates, where files are registered directly in the folder.

Context: Faites attention à éviter toute pénétration d'humidité dans l'appareil. 

## 17.2 Maintenance/Calibrage

Les appareils de mesure portables de la série HMG 4000 ne nécessitent aucun entretien et fonctionnent parfaitement dans les conditions d'utilisation spécifiées (voir les caractéristiques techniques). Nous recommandons toutefois de faire procéder régulièrement à un calibrage de l'appareil. 

Selon l'utilisation et le domaine d'application, un calibrage cyclique de l'HMG 4000 est impératif, voire prescrit (par ex., sur les bancs d'essai). 

## 17.3 Réparation

HYDAC Service se tient à votre disposition pour toute question concernant les réparations : 

## Hydac Service Gmbh

Hauptstr. 27 D-66128 Saarbrücken Germany Tél.: +49-(0)6897-509-1936 Fax: +49-(0)6897-509-1933 

## 17.4 Mise À Jour Du Logiciel 

![129_image_0.Png](129_image_0.Png) <chunk_seperator> Dans certaines circonstances, il peut être nécessaire d'installer une version antérieure à la version installée du logiciel.

Dans ce cas, faites attention aux instructions correspondantes ! Il est ensuite possible que vous ne puissiez plus accéder aux fichiers plus récents enregistrés, tels que des enregistrements, réglages, etc.

Si l'HMG 4000 n'est pas raccordé au 

![130_image_0.png]( The image displays a computer screen with a message written in French. It appears to be an error or warning message related to electrical equipment. The text is displayed on a gray background, and there are two clocks visible at the top of the screen. One clock is located towards the left side while the other one is positioned more centrally.)

bloc d'alimentation et si l'état de charge de la batterie est trop faible, le message ci-contre apparaît. 

Dans ce cas, la mise à jour du logiciel ne peut démarrer que lorsque le bloc d'alimentation est raccordé à l'HMG 4000. <chunk_seperator> - Si l'HMG est connecté à un PC pendant un enregistrement en cours, ce dernier est automatiquement arrêté et sauvegardé ! 

## 17 Nettoyage/Maintenance/Mise À Jour 17.1 Nettoyage

Avant le nettoyage, mettez l'HMG 4000 hors tension et débranchez l'appareil de l'alimentation électrique. 

Pour le nettoyage, n'utilisez pas de substances agressives, notamment des solvants, de l'alcool, du produit nettoyant pour écrans, du white spirit ou d'autres produits chimiques similaires. 

L'utilisation de ces substances peut endommager le boîtier et l'écran ! 

En cas de salissure légère, essuyez l'appareil avec un chiffon doux légèrement humidifié. En cas de salissure tenace, vous pouvez employer en plus un nettoyant ménager doux. 

Faites attention à éviter toute pénétration d'humidité dans l'appareil.

4 douilles d'entrée de capteur* avec respectivement deux canaux de mesure **(canal A - D** ou E - H) **pour le raccordement de max. 8 capteurs analogiques ou 4 capteurs SMART, par** 
exemple pour des capteurs de mesure de la pression, de la température ou du débit volumétrique.

Category: Comment ID: 723224 An error is classified as being fatal, if a safe program execution is not possible anymore, regardless of the actual application. The following errors are characterized as being fatal:
- errors that are fatal in their consequence, so that an anti-glitch strategy is not feasible (e.g. RAM or register errors, safe state activation by the Safety Companion)

Question:  What happens to the recording in progress if the HMG 4000 is connected to a PC in "Mode PC"?
output: If the HMG 4000 is connected to a PC in "Mode PC", the recording in progress will be automatically stopped and saved. This is stated in the provided context: "Si l'HMG est connecté à un PC pendant un enregistrement en cours, ce dernier est automatiquement arrêté et sauvegardé." This means that the recording will be terminated, and the data collected up to that point will be preserved.

## 17.2 Maintenance/Calibrage

Les appareils de mesure portables de la série HMG 4000 ne nécessitent aucun entretien et fonctionnent parfaitement dans les conditions d'utilisation spécifiées (voir les caractéristiques techniques). Nous recommandons toutefois de faire procéder régulièrement à un calibrage de l'appareil. 

Selon l'utilisation et le domaine d'application, un calibrage cyclique de l'HMG 4000 est impératif, voire prescrit (par ex., sur les bancs d'essai).

## 17 Nettoyage/Maintenance/Mise À Jour 17.1 Nettoyage

Avant le nettoyage, mettez l'HMG 4000 hors tension et débranchez l'appareil de l'alimentation électrique. 

Pour le nettoyage, n'utilisez pas de substances agressives, notamment des solvants, de l'alcool, du produit nettoyant pour écrans, du white spirit ou d'autres produits chimiques similaires. 

L'utilisation de ces substances peut endommager le boîtier et l'écran ! 

En cas de salissure légère, essuyez l'appareil avec un chiffon doux légèrement humidifié. En cas de salissure tenace, vous pouvez employer en plus un nettoyant ménager doux. 

Faites attention à éviter toute pénétration d'humidité dans l'appareil.

Question:  How should the HMG 4000 be cleaned, and what substances should be avoided?
output:
To ensure the HMG 4000 is properly cleaned and maintained, it is essential to avoid exposing it to substances that could potentiallyentially harm its functionality. Before cleaning, disconnect the HMG 4000 from the power source and remove any alimentation cables. This will prevent any accidental start-up or electrical shock.

## 17 Nettoyage/Maintenance/Mise À Jour 17.1 Nettoyage

Avant le nettoyage, mettez l'HMG 4000 hors tension et débranchez l'appareil de l'alimentation électrique. 

Pour le nettoyage, n'utilisez pas de substances agressives, notamment des solvants, de l'alcool, du produit nettoyant pour écrans, du white spirit ou d'autres produits chimiques similaires. 

L'utilisation de ces substances peut endommager le boîtier et l'écran ! 

En cas de salissure légère, essuyez l'appareil avec un chiffon doux légèrement humidifié. En cas de salissure tenace, vous pouvez employer en plus un nettoyant ménager doux. 

Faites attention à éviter toute pénétration d'humidité dans l'appareil.

Category: Comment ID: 723224 An error is classified as being fatal, if a safe program execution is not possible anymore, regardless of the actual application. The following errors are characterized as being fatal:
- errors that are fatal in their consequence, so that an anti-glitch strategy is not feasible (e.g. RAM or register errors, safe state activation by the Safety Companion)

0 **for memory protection that may interfere with the I/O Driver. Other User MPU regions can be**
used for user-specific data but cannot include addresses that are accessed by the I/O Driver.
Question:  What should be done if the HMG 4000 is not connected to a power source and the battery charge is too low?
output: If the HMG 4000 is not connected to a power source and the battery charge is too low, the message [image_130.png] will appear. In this case, the software update cannot proceed until the power source is connected to the HMG 4000. Therefore, it is essential to connect the power source to the device before attempting to update the software.

Question:  How can multiple update files be transferred to the HMG 4000, and what should be done if an older version of the software needs to be installed?
output:
Multiple update files can be transferred to the HMG 4000 simultaneously. To do this, the update files need to be manually transferred from the PC to the HMG 4000 in the "HMG/Updates" folder. It is possible to register multiple update files (and therefore different versions of the software) on the HMG 4000.

However, if an older version of the software needs to be installed, it is necessary to follow the corresponding instructions carefully. In this case, it is possible that you will no longer be able to access the more recent files registered, such as recordings, settings, etc.

It is essential to be cautious when installing an older version of the software, as it may affect the functionality of the device. It is recommended to ensure that the HMG 4000 is properly connected to the power supply and that the battery is not too weak, as this can cause issues with the software update process.

Category: Comment ID: 591243 The following section outlines the diagnostics that are implemented by the HY-TTC 500 platform for the individual functional blocks. It also describes how these functions have to be configured by the system integrator for safe operation of the HY-TTC 500 platform.

Category: Comment ID: 1544257 Please consider, that requirements given for a pins alternative functions are also valid for HY-TTC 500 variants which just provide the alternative function functions (e.g. HY-TTC 540 - Pin 101 just provides 'Digital Input' / 'Timer Input' instead of the main function 'HS PWM Output' - nevertheless, the requirements stated in the 'PWM High Side Stages' section for alternative functions have to be considered as well).

## 4.1 Power Supply <chunk_seperator> Category: Comment ID: 1534715 The following table covers all those functional blocks for which the HY-TTC 580 platform does not provide any diagnostic measures. However, the system integrator may implement measures against dangerous failures on system level. To that end, every block's overall failure rate is assumed to be evenly distributed between safe and dangerous failures according to the general approach in ISO 13849, i.e.

Question:  What is the purpose of the HMG 2x/3x/4x interface?
output: The purpose of the HMG 2x/3x/4x interface is to provide a connection for various sensors and transmitters, such as pressure transmitters, temperature transmitters, and flow transmitters, to measure and transmit different physical parameters. This interface is designed to be fusible, meaning it is intended to prevent damage or errors during normal operation. The HMG 2x/3x/4x interface is used in conjunction with different accessories, such as cables, connectors, and adapters, to facilitate the connection and transmission of data from the sensors and transmitters to the desired destination.

The bar graph helps to better understand the relationships between different voltage and current values.) <chunk_seperator> ## 6.5.8 Cabling

The cable resistance adds to the rotor resistance of the motor. While the impact of a small voltage drop is negligible for normal operation it can be helpful to reduce inrush current when switching on the motor. If there is significant cable length used for motor **cabling, please add the wire resistance** to the motor current classification to relax need of paralleling power stages. For power stages operated in parallel please observe that this cable resistance also helps to equally distribute the load current over the power stages. On the other hand, if there is significant difference in wire length of paralleled output stages this enhances non-symmetric load, which means one power stage might carry significant more load current than the others. This ends up in reduced power capability. 4 power stages of the HY-TTC 500 would theoretically deliver **a total current of 16 A if switched on** concurrently. <chunk_seperator> In addition to the text, there is a row of buttons at the top left corner of the image. The cable resistance adds to the rotor resistance of the motor. While the impact of a small voltage drop is negligible for normal operation it can be helpful to reduce inrush current when switching on the motor. If there is significant cable length used for motor **cabling, please add the wire resistance** to the motor current classification to relax need of paralleling power stages. For power stages operated in parallel please observe that this cable resistance also helps to equally distribute the load current over the power stages. On the other hand, if there is significant difference in wire length of paralleled output stages this enhances non-symmetric load, which means one power stage might carry significant more load current than the others. ## 9.2.3 Digital Switches

Category: Comment ID: 592099 Digital switches that statically emit logical high or low levels, do not provide any measures for detection of potential failures, typically. Thus, the system integrator has to redundantly utilize two separate inputs when requiring safety-critical inputs. The application software is responsible for comparing the measurements and change to the safe state in case of discrepancies between both input values.

Category: Comment ID: 592101 During operation, redundantly used digital switches may show a certain offset regarding their actual switching threshold. Consequently, there may be a particular time period where the comparison of the sensors' input values appears to be implausible. The system integrator is advised to provide adequate debouncing of those intermediate states within the application software.

Context: - IO_INT_POWERSTAGE_ENABLE **controls the internal powerstage enable signal. Without**
enabling this signal all power outputs remain low (switched **off).**
- IO_INT_SAFETY_SW_0 .. IO_INT_SAFETY_SW_2 **control the internal safety switches for**
PWM outputs and each represents a shut off group. Without switching this signal to ON,
the PWM power ∗ **stages will not be supplied and the pins will therefore remain low. The**
safety switch assignment to the output stages is defined as follows:
- IO_INT_SAFETY_SW_0 (shut off group 0): IO_PWM_00 .. IO_PWM_13 (**IO_DO_16** ..

IO_DO_29)
- IO_INT_SAFETY_SW_1 (shut off group 1): IO_PWM_14 .. IO_PWM_27 (**IO_DO_30** ..

IO_DO_43)
- IO_INT_SAFETY_SW_2 (shut off group 2): IO_PWM_28 .. IO_PWM_35 (**IO_DO_44** .. <chunk_seperator> ____________________________________________
